chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Paul Perez-Lebron

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($7,500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 7500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant John Paul Perez-Lebron not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered no contact with MEA (03/06/1956); RLN (09/15/1952)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered signature bond reinstated.  Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John Paul Perez-Lebron in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant John Paul Perez-Lebron in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Paul Perez-Lebron appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.   AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defense motion to dismiss "crime against an elderly or disabled person enhancer.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS dismissal of enhancers.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 7500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant John Paul Perez-Lebron not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/25/2022 @ 1p
